title: What are the disadvantages of Rust (Programming Language)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here are some disadvantages of rust programming language: it does not have the level of monkeypatching supported by languages like Python or Perl.You cant develop code as ‘fast’ as scripting languages like Python or Ruby.You will have lots of ‘fun’ trying to get your code to actually compile.Because it is a new language, people still complain about syntax.its not webscale. /sIt’s usually considered harder to write code that can’t rely on garbage collection, even with the borrow checker helping you.Compared to C++ and especially C, Rust often produces larger binaries and less efficient code; the compiler is also considerably slower. I think Rust can overcome all of these issues in time, but for now…

At the start, let's say that we have more Advantages than disadvantages. And now, we’ll talking about them. 1. IDE. Yeah, we have JetBrains for rust, some editors, etc. But we haven’t equally comfort with them, like we have it with java (eclipse-jee, intellij) or C++ (visual studio, eclipse-cdt). 2. Standartization. Strict standard for this language. Yeah, you may see the pretty documentation with colored examples, but it isn’t the same. 3. If Rust is your first programming language, it’ll be easy for you, in my point of view, to learn it, and used to syntax. But if you’ve already known java/C/C++/swift/python/etc. - you’ll find that the syntax of Rust strange, at least. 4. Big base of development in enterprise systems. 5. When we’ll have about 100k big/completed/succesfull/maintained/proprietary projects in Rust, we can talk about how we can get the profit with the knowledge of Rust.
